thread.title: Prince plays free intimate gig for basketball champs
thread.title_full: Prince plays free intimate gig for basketball champs

author: WENN Newsdesk
title: Prince plays free intimate gig for basketball champs
text:
Entertainment Prince plays free intimate gig for basketball champs Prince helped a triumphant U.S. women's basketball team celebrate a prestigious victory by playing a free three-hour concert for the players and club staff. Prince plays free intimate gig for basketball champs Recording artist Prince performs during the 2013 Billboard Music Awards at the MGM Grand Garden Arena on May 19, 2013 in Las Vegas, Nevada. (Photo by Ethan Miller/Getty Images) Travel Deals Filed Under: Celebrities & Gossip 
Prince helped a triumphant U.S. women's basketball team celebrate a prestigious victory by playing a free three-hour concert for the players and club staff. 
Prince is a big fan of the Minnesota Lynx sports side and he was thrilled when the stars won the Women's National Basketball Association (WNBA) championship on Wednesday evening. To celebrate, he invited the players, training staff, and stadium officials to his Paisley Park complex in Minnesota following the win, and he took to the stage after midnight to play an epic gig, according to the local Star Tribune newspaper. 
During the concert, which finished at around 4am on Thursday, video screens flashed up the message "2015 WNBA Champions", and Prince even played a version of classic Queen track We Are The Champions.
